questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "I am happy."
options: He said that I am happy
He said that he was happy
He said that he is happy
He said that I was happy
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'he', 'am' (present) changes to 'was' (past). Correct: He said that he was happy.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "Where do you live?"
options: She asked where do I live
She asked that where I lived
questions.explanation: 'Said' changes to 'asked', question becomes statement form. Correct: She asked where I lived.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said to me, "Please help me."
options: He ordered me to help him
He requested me to help him
He said me to help him
questions.explanation: 'Please' indicates a request. Use 'requested' + object + to + verb. 'Me' becomes 'him' in reported speech.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "How beautiful the sunset is!"
options: He exclaimed that how beautiful the sunset is
He exclaimed with joy that the sunset was very beautiful
He said that the sunset is beautiful
He exclaimed that the sunset is very beautiful
questions.explanation: Exclamatory sentences use 'exclaimed with emotion'. 'How' is removed, 'very' is added, and 'is' changes to 'was'.
